docs.snippet: William Lombardy of New York was among the winners in the second round of the annual international chess masters tournament at Mar del Plata in Argentina, according to a report received through South Ameriican news sources yesterday.
docs.lead_paragraph: William Lombardy of New York was among the winners in the second round of the annual international chess masters tournament at Mar del Plata in Argentina, according to a report received through South Ameriican news sources yesterday.

headline.main: LOMBARDY SCORES IN MASTERS CHESS; Defeats Rossetto in Thirty Moves at Mar del Plata -Three Tie for Lead
Miss Hanson Leads by Stroke in Augusta Golf; COAST STAR GETS OPENING-ROUND 72 Miss Hanson Stroke Ahead of Miss Berg -- Three Are Deadlocked at 74

docs.snippet: AUGUSTA, Ga., March 14 (AP) -- Mrs. Marlene Hagge of Delray Beach, Fla., sank an eighteen-foot putt on the eighteenth hole today to gain a one-stroke lead at the halfway mark in the seventy-two-hole women's titleholders golf tournament.
docs.lead_paragraph: AUGUSTA, Ga., March 14 (AP) -- Mrs. Marlene Hagge of Delray Beach, Fla., sank an eighteen-foot putt on the eighteenth hole today to gain a one-stroke lead at the halfway mark in the seventy-two-hole women's titleholders golf tournament.

headline.main: MRS. HAGGE AHEAD ON LINKS WITH 149

docs.snippet: THE first "Spring National Tournament" is now under way at Atlantic City, in the Traymore Hotel. For nearly thirty years (since 1929) there have been two national tournaments each year, one the first week in August, the other the first week in...
docs.lead_paragraph: THE first "Spring National Tournament" is now under way at Atlantic City, in the Traymore Hotel. For nearly thirty years (since 1929) there have been two national tournaments each year, one the first week in August, the other the first week in December. Beginning this year, there will be three.

headline.main: BRIDGE: VANDERBILT CUP PLAY; Team - of - Four Contest Begins on Thursday At Atlantic City

byline.original: Special to The New York Times

docs.snippet: AUGUSTA, Ga., March 15 (AP) -- Beverly Hanson of India, Calif., used a strong putting game to regain the lead today in the third round of the 72-hole titleholders golf tournament.
docs.lead_paragraph: AUGUSTA, Ga., March 15 (AP) -- Beverly Hanson of India, Calif., used a strong putting game to regain the lead today in the third round of the 72-hole titleholders golf tournament.

headline.main: Miss Hanson Regains Lead in Titleholders Golf;; COAST PRO CARDS 73 FOR 225 TOTAL Miss Hanson Three Strokes Ahead of Miss Crocker -- Ford Gets 70 for 205

docs.snippet: Arthur B. Bisguier, defending his Manhattan Chess Club title, gained his second consecutive victory yesterday, defeating Howard Cohen.
docs.lead_paragraph: Arthur B. Bisguier, defending his Manhattan Chess Club title, gained his second consecutive victory yesterday, defeating Howard Cohen.

headline.main: BISGUIER VICTOR AFTER 32 MOVES; Beats Cohen at Manhattan Chess Club -- Bernstein Scores at Marshall

docs.snippet: The top four in the annual international chess masters tournament at Mar del Plata retained their positions in the standing after yesterday's play in the fifth round, according to a report received through Argentine news sources.
docs.lead_paragraph: The top four in the annual international chess masters tournament at Mar del Plata retained their positions in the standing after yesterday's play in the fifth round, according to a report received through Argentine news sources.

headline.main: LOMBARDY, PANNO DRAW IN 41 MOVES; Larsen Wins Fifth Straight in Mar del Plata Chess -- Sanguinetti Victor

docs.snippet: Bent Larsen of Denmark continued his winning streak to hold the lead with a score of 6 -- 0 in the annual international chess masters tournament at Mar del Plata yesterday.
docs.lead_paragraph: Bent Larsen of Denmark continued his winning streak to hold the lead with a score of 6 -- 0 in the annual international chess masters tournament at Mar del Plata yesterday.

headline.main: LARSEN GAINS IN CHESS; He Sets Back Rossetto in 36 Moves at Mar del Plata
